title: Barclays Profit Soars on Investment Banking
sub_head: Chief Executive Jes Staley has staked his strategy on reinvigorating the investment bank
body:
LONDON— Barclays PLC Wednesday said its net profit rose in the second quarter, driven by a strong performance in its investment bank.
The London-based bank earned £2.11 billion, equivalent to $2.92 billion, in the three months to the end of June, up from £90 million in the same period last year.
Barclays Chief Executive Jes Staley has staked his strategy on reinvigorating the investment bank. The bank recently promoted several executives to new roles and has targeted becoming the fifth-largest investment bank by revenue, usurping the position held by Citigroup Inc.
The bank’s shares rose more than 4% Wednesday morning in London. Barclays said it plans to buy back £500 million of shares and will pay a dividend of 2 pence a share for the first six months of the year. The Bank of England stopped U.K. banks paying dividends last year to conserve capital in the pandemic.
“Our investment banking fees and equities businesses have delivered record income,” Mr. Staley said of the bank’s performance in the first half of 2021.
